reviews.review_text:
I have dined here twice as once was not enough. I had fish thali on the day I arrived and before leaving I made sure to relish the food again. Food is good, hygienic place and varieties available.
Make sure you know your allergies before you place your order.

After recommendation from the hotel staff and online reviews I went to this family run restaurant for a lunch. Ordered a goan fish thali and a plate of King fish which they offer as an add-on to the thali and not individually.
After placing the order you have to wait for 15-20 minutes as food is prepared fresh. Food was good and flavour full. Light on stomach but filling. I even asked for extra curry and was provided free of cost.
Only complaint is regarding the thickness of the fish but still manageable. Price is nominal as compared to what restaurants are charging in Goa.

They were playing old hindi movie songs from 70s which were very soothing. The setup is very basic and nothing fancy but clean and maintained. Plastic tables and chairs. This place is really popular and gets filled up in no time and sometimes even run out of fish so its better to call before going.

Parking is a challenge and they don't allow drinking alcohol or smoking inside their premises.

A place to try authentic Goan fish thali. The veg thali is also good. They have Kokam soda as well as some other cold drinks.
Service is okay. Half the things on the menu were not available in November.
